alpha.meaning: Significance level for conditional independence tests
alpha.reasoning: Use higher values (0.1) for small samples (<500) to avoid missing dependencies. Use lower values (0.01) for large samples (>10000) to control false positives. Default 0.05 works well for moderate sample sizes.

is_discrete.meaning: Whether the data contains discrete variables
is_discrete.reasoning: Set to true for discrete or mixed data types to use appropriate statistical tests. Set to false for purely continuous data to optimize test selection.
